verses.text: Hear therefore, O \add ye\add* kings, and understand; learn, \add ye that be\add* judges of the ends of the earth.
Give ear, you that rule the people, and glory in the multitude of nations.
For power is given you of the Lord, and sovereignty from the Highest, who shall try your works, and search out \add your\add* counsels.
Because, being ministers of his kingdom, you have not judged aright, nor kept the law, nor walked after the counsel of God;
horribly and speedily shall he come upon you: for a sharp judgment shall be to them that be in high places.
For mercy will \add soon\add* pardon the meanest: but mighty \add men\add* shall be mightily tormented.
For he which is Lord over all shall fear no \add man’s\add* person, neither shall he stand in awe of \add any man’s\add* greatness: for he hath made the small and great, and careth for all alike.
But a sore trial shall come upon the mighty.
Unto you therefore, O kings, do I speak, that ye may learn wisdom, and not fall away.
For they that keep holiness holily shall be judged holy: and they that have learned such \add things\add* shall find what to answer.
Wherefore set your affection upon my words; desire \add them\add*, and ye shall be instructed.
Wisdom is glorious, and never fadeth away: yea, she is easily seen of them that love her, and found of such as seek her.
She preventeth them that desire \add her\add*, in making herself first known \add unto them\add*.
Whoso seeketh her early shall have no great travail: for he shall find \add her\add* sitting at his doors.
To think therefore upon her \add is\add* perfection of wisdom: and whoso watcheth for her shall quickly be without care.
For she goeth about seeking \add such as are\add* worthy of her, sheweth herself favourably unto them in the ways, and meeteth them in every thought.
For the very true beginning of her \add is\add* the desire of discipline; and the care of discipline \add is\add* love;
and love \add is\add* the keeping of her laws; and the giving heed unto \add her\add* laws \add is\add* the assurance of incorruption;
and incorruption maketh \add us\add* near unto God:
therefore the desire of wisdom bringeth to a kingdom.
If your delight be then in thrones and sceptres, O \add ye\add* kings of the people, honour wisdom, that ye may reign for evermore.

As for wisdom, what she is, and how she came \add up\add*, I will tell \add you\add*, and will not hide mysteries from you: but will seek \add her\add* out from the beginning of \add her\add* nativity, and bring the knowledge of her into light, and will not pass over the truth.
Neither will I go with consuming envy; for such \add a man\add* shall have no fellowship with wisdom.
But the multitude of the wise \add is\add* the welfare of the world: and a wise king \add is\add* the upholding of the people.
Receive therefore instruction through my words, and it shall do you good.
